summary: "(What's the Story) Morning Glory?" is Oasis' second album, released in 1995. It was their big break, turning them into a global rock sensation. The album had a different sound from their first, with more string instruments and bigger choruses. It featured hits like "Wonderwall" and "Don't Look Back in Anger." Despite mixed reviews at first, it's now seen as a super important album in British music. It sold super well, over 22 million copies worldwide, and won awards, including Best British Album at the Brit Awards in 1996.
title: (What's the Story) Morning Glory
